intro: Astragalus palaestinus subsp. hierosolymitanus, commonly known as the Holy Land milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing a high degree of drought tolerance. Its subspecies status reflects its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other Astragalus species. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization.
